Wait! I cannot enter these lands.

Lord Greythane must have forgiven you by now.

Greythane will never forgive me. I will never forgive myself.
Greythane will never forgive me. I will never forgive myself.

We've been traveling together a very long time, Syrus. You've never told me what this is all about.

That wasn't an observation Syrus, it was a request. You've helped Agaria so many times. Now let us help you.

Syrus...
Syrus...
Syrus...
Syrus...
Oh, very well, if it will get you to leave me alone.

I was in love with the daughter of Lord Greythane, the Duke of Maethelburg. We were betrothed against her father's wishes. He did not want his daughter to marry a 'half-breed', as he called me.

We eloped one night. We intended to travel west to Drakenburg and live there until Lord Greythane eventually accepted us back.
We eloped one night. We intended to travel west to Drakenburg and live there until Lord Greythane eventually accepted us back.

But on the way there, near Skellheim, I caught the trail of a sorceror and stupidly we followed it. I thought there would be little harm in hunting down one Dark Wizard on the way.
But on the way there, near Skellheim, I caught the trail of a sorceror and stupidly we followed it. I thought there would be little harm in hunting down one Dark Wizard on the way.

But on the way there, near Skellheim, I caught the trail of a sorceror and stupidly we followed it. I thought there would be little harm in hunting down one Dark Wizard on the way.

I defeated the sorceror, but he rose up again, more powerful than ever. Before I knew what was happening, Liandra lay dead in my arms, and Wights were surrounding us. I managed to escape, but I could not even find Liandra's body to return to her father. He has every right to hate me.

You have my word, Syrus, I will do whatever I can to make this right.
